perturbation.original_text:
A.       SIERRA is the manufacture and producer of a joint health product called          "SierraSil" (hereinafter "the Product") for human use.

B.       ENVISION is the manufacturer of certain nutritional  supplements and is          desirous of becoming an  exclusive  distributor  for the Product in any          blend  with  Krill Oil  (hereinafter  "the  Finished  Product")  in all          distribution  channels in the Territory on the terms and conditions set          forth herein.

C.       SIERRA is desirous of having ENVISION act as its exclusive  distributor          for the Product in any blend with Krill Oil in all distribution          channels in the Territory on the terms and conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text:
A.       SIERRA is the manufacturer and producer of a product called          "SierraSil" (hereinafter "the Product") for human use.

B.       ENVISION is the manufacturer of certain nutritional supplements and is          desirous of becoming a distributor for the Product in all          distribution channels in the Territory on the terms and conditions set          forth herein.

C.       SIERRA is desirous of having ENVISION act as its distributor for the Product in all distribution channels in the Territory on the terms and conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'joint health' from the definition of 'SierraSil,' the definition of 'the Product' becomes vague. By removing the word 'exclusive' and 'in any blend with Krill Oil', the agreement becomes less defined which will cause future potential issues. This introduces uncertainty in enforcement regarding product scope and exclusivity.

perturbation.original_text:
9.       Purchase  Requirements.  During the  term of this  Agreement,  ENVISION          will  exclusively  purchase  the  Product  from   SIERRA.  The  parties          mutually agree to the Purchase Price of:

         Product                          Purchase Price          -----------------------------------------------          A.  SierraSil                    Per Sierra Sil's wholesale price list.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.       Purchase  Requirements.  During the  term of this  Agreement,  ENVISION          will purchase the  Product  from   SIERRA. The parties agree to negotiate the Purchase Price:

         Product                          Purchase Price          -----------------------------------------------          A.  SierraSil
perturbation.explanation: Removing the word exclusively changes the nature of the agreement. The removal of 'mutually' and 'wholesale price list' and replacing it with 'negotiate the purchase price' introduces a contradiction, as the contract initially specified a fixed pricing mechanism. This makes enforcement uncertain, as the price is now subject to negotiation without a clear fallback if an agreement isn't reached. By removing the price, it creates a lack of specificity to the contract. This means there's no longer a clear agreement on how purchase requirements are defined.

perturbation.original_text: 11.      Trademarks  SIERRA  is the  owner of the  trademark&sbsp; "SierraSil".  This          Agreement  grants  ENVISION a  non-exclusive  and  non-royalty  bearing          license to use the mark  "SierraSil".  SIERRA shall at all times be the          owner of the  trademark and ENVISION  shall acquire no rights  thereto.          Upon  termination,  ENVISION shall have eighteen (18) months to exhaust          any  inventories,  packaging  and  advertising  materials  bearing  the          "SierraSil"  trademark  and SIERRA  shall have first option to buy back          any inventory at ENVISION's net purchase price.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.      Trademarks  SIERRA  is the  owner of the  trademark&sbsp; "SierraSil". This Agreement  grants  ENVISION a  license to use the mark  "SierraSil". SIERRA shall at all times be the owner of the trademark and ENVISION shall acquire no rights thereto.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the terms 'non-exclusive' and 'non-royalty bearing' creates ambiguity regarding the nature of the trademark license granted to ENVISION. Also, omitting 'Upon termination, ENVISION shall have eighteen (18) months to exhaust any inventories, packaging and advertising materials bearing the "SierraSil" trademark and SIERRA shall have first option to buy back any inventory at ENVISION's net purchase price.' introduces a contradiction as there is no direction regarding what happens to their inventory once the contract ends.
